label: Permitted file extensions
value: ppt, xls, csv, doc, jpg, png, gif, zip, tar, rar, gz, bz2, 7z, mp4, mp3, pdf, ico, docx, pptx, xlsx, ods, xml
description: Mentioned extensions of files are allowed within a data stack

label: API logs retention (d)
description: It refers to the time-to-live (TTL) duration, in days, for API logs. It represents the number of days that API logs should be retained before they are automatically deleted from the system.

label: API Timeout (s)
description: Predefined duration that determines the maximum amount of time allowed for an API request to complete before it times out.
usedIn: mon, sm, gm, ne, sm, user

label: Azure AD id
description: The unique identifier assigned to an application or service registered in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) for authentication and authorization purposes.

label: Azure AD password
description: The confidential key or password assigned to an application or service registered in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) for authentication and secure communication with other resources.

label: Azure AD directory/organization identifier
description: The directory or organization identifier in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) that represents a distinct instance of Azure AD containing users, groups, and applications.

label: Azure AD additional user attributes
description: The attribute or property associated with a user in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), containing additional information such as name, email, job title, or custom user attributes.

label: Agent max log file size
description: Max file size of logs of an agent

label: Agent log retention (d)
description: Number of log file or days in an agent

label: Agent log file rotation strategy
description: Log file rotation strategy days or size

label: Agent max file size
description: Max file size that can be uploaded to the agent for a flow.

label: Toggle trusted IP
description: To Enable/Disable Trusted IP Feature in UI

label: System voume for flow pods
description: This is pure file system volume for the flow pods. The recommended path for this is /tmp/flow . All data services will share this path. We do not support the configuration involving Persistent Volumes and Persistent Volume Claims as of now.

label: Max concurrent files
description: Number of files that can be sent to the flow.
Maximum wait time taken for updating the pending flow status to unknown status
Number of seconds to keep a heartbeat message sent by an agent.
Number to consecutive heartbeat misses to consider the agent as offline.
Milliseconds to wait to open a connection
Maximum records to be retrieved while searching the directory.

label: Temp. file mountpath for data services
description: This is pure file system volume for the data service pods. The recommended path for this is /tmp/ds . All data services will share this path. We do not support the configuration involving Persistent Volumes and Persistent Volume Claims as of now.

label: Function log retention (d)
description: Retention time for Function logs.

label: Google API key
description: Google API Key required to render maps.

label: Connection timeout (s)
description: Maximum time in seconds to wait for a response for a hook.

label: Concurrent outbound requests
description: Maximum number of parallel API request that will made to external system in case of Post hooks.

label: Retry limit
description: Maximum number to retries to establish a connection
The distinguished name (DN) that serves as the starting point or base for LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) operations, defining the scope of the directory search.
The filter expression used in LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) queries to specify the base criteria for searching and retrieving entries from the directory.

label: Distinquished name for LDAP
description: The distinguished name (DN) used for authenticating and establishing a session with an LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) server.

label: Password for LDAP
description: The password or credentials used for authenticating and establishing a session with an LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) server.

label: LDAP server url
description: The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that specifies the network address and port number for connecting to an LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) server.

label: Max. File size
description: Beta.Max file size for attachments or file mapper

label: Max. JSON size
description: Beta. Max JSON payload that the data.stack accepts
usedIn: bm, common, cm, gm, sm, user

label: Events hook
description: URL where the data.stack events will be published.

label: Nodejs heap size
description: Max heap size of generated data service.

label: Secret key for JWTs
description: The secret key or cryptographic key used for signing and verifying JSON Web Tokens (JWTs) in a role-based access control (RBAC) system, ensuring the integrity and authenticity of the token.
usedIn: cm, bm, common, mon, sm, gm, user

label: TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED
description: Allow/Deny data.stack to make connections requests to systems with expired or invalid certificates.

label: Default timezone
description: Default timezone for apps.

label: UI Logs TTL (s)
description: Retention time for UI logs in seconds
List of comma seperated cluster nodes
Host for the cache service
Port for the cache service

description: Docker registry URL
usedIn: cm, bm, sm, cm, bm, user

description: Encryption key
Toggle experimental features

The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) is the complete domain name for accessing data.stack over the internet/network. If you access data.stack via the URL https://data.stack.appveen.com:8443 then value of FQDN should be data.stack.appveen.com:8443.
info/debug Used to set the verbosity of the logs. Pod restart is required for this to take effect.

description: Validity in minutes for the JWT token of a bot. Minimum value must be 15
Heartbeat interval in seconds
Number of heartbeats allowed to be missed
The set of rules or requirements defining the complexity criteria for user passwords in a role-based access control (RBAC) system, such as minimum length, character types, and password expiration.
Minimum length of the password.

The available authentication modes or methods supported by a role-based access control (RBAC) system for user authentication, such as username/password, single sign-on (SSO), or multi-factor authentication (MFA).
To set whether to logout if window is closed
The duration of the cooldown period imposed on a user's login attempts after reaching the maximum failure threshold.
The time period during which repeated failed login attempts are tracked for access restriction purposes.
The maximum number of failed login attempts allowed before enforcing access restrictions.

If RBAC_USER_TO_SINGLE_SESSION true Then if RBAC_USER_RELOGIN_ACTION deny, when the user logs in a message similar to “You are already logged-in through another window. Please logout before logging in here.” is shown in the UI.

Then if RBAC_USER_RELOGIN_ACTION allow, when the user logs in a message similar to “You are already logged-in through another window. If you continue, you will be logged out from the other session.” is shown in the UI
Whether to allow user to log into multiple user session.
Validity in minutes for the JWT token. Minimum value must be 15.
A communication channel or platform that enables real-time streaming of audio, video, or data content over the internet for broadcasting or on-demand consumption.
